page.title: 05CANAL
page.content: In 1768 an Act of Parliament enabled the construction of a canal running through Atherstone linking The Grand Trunk (Trent and Mersey Canal)to Coventry. The Coventry Canal Company dismissed James Brindley,the appointed engineer and surveyor in 1769 after a disagreement. At the end of 1771 the canal was open from Coventry to Atherstone but it was not until 1790 that the extension to the junction at Fazeley was opened.The canal formed an important link between London and the North.Many goods became cheaper.Coal, lime and limestone could be carried to the town.Corn merchants also benefited from cheaper transport.The canal trade as most profitable in tne 1820's and steadily declined from 1830 to 1947,the year of nationalisation.
